meanings.definition: A stack of hay, straw, or similar material
meanings.sent1: The farmer stored the ricks of hay in the barn.
meanings.sent2: The children played hide-and-seek around the ricks of straw.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy jumped on the ricks of hay, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: The ricks of straw stood tall in the field like miniature skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The golden ricks of hay glowed in the sunlight, creating a picturesque scene.

meanings.definition: To pile up in a disorderly manner
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the leaves began to ricks in the corner of the yard.
meanings.sent2: Please do not ricks your clothes on the floor, keep them tidy.
meanings.sent3: The toys seemed to ricks themselves in the playroom every night.
meanings.sent4: The paperwork continued to ricks on the desk, waiting to be sorted.
meanings.sent5: The dishes started to ricks in the sink, signaling it was time to wash them.

meanings.definition: To twist or sprain (a body part)
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to ricks your ankle while hiking on uneven terrain.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally ricks her wrist while trying to catch the falling vase.
meanings.sent3: He always manages to ricks his back when lifting heavy boxes.
meanings.sent4: The dancer had to stop the performance after ricksing her knee during a jump.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to sit out the game after ricksing his shoulder during practice.
